description:
When I try to start an instance with a keypair that doesn't exist, I get an error message that includes the Python templating syntax...

root@cloud:/root# euca-run-instances -k mykey -t m1.tiny ami-00000002
KeypairNotFound: Keypair %(keypair_name)s not found for user %(user_id)s
title: Specifying an unknown key produces a non-templated error message

comments.content:
When I try to start an instance with a keypair that doesn't exist, I get an error message that includes the Python templating syntax...

root@cloud:/root# euca-run-instances -k mykey -t m1.tiny ami-00000002

comments.content:
Hello justinsb, or anyone else affected,

Accepted nova into oneiric-proposed, the package will build now and be available in a few hours. Please test and give feedback here. See https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Testing/EnableProposed for documentation how to enable and use -proposed. Thank you in advance!
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~pitti

comments.content:
Hi Martin-

I'm not sure why but, like Bug #861160, this bug is apparently fixed in this upload but for some reason the one-line fix is missing from the source tree, both in the orig.tar.gz as well as the debian/patches directory.
